Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi Dan,
 
you may also have a look at http://jsunit.berlios.de
<http://jsun=
it.berlios.de> . This version is more based on command-line.
Edward and me =
are trying to merge our two versions one day, but we're
currently both busy=
.
 
To your problem: Can you separate this function in an external JavaScri=
pt
file or does it have to be embedded into the HTML code? If you are able =
to
extract it you may use my version of JsUnit to test the function's logic=

from command line (use WSH, Rhino or SpiderMonkey) providing mock objects =
in
your test case that represent the variables and objects normally set by =
the
browser. With this approach you are able to testify your function's log=
ic
and you can continue with the rest using one browser since you know your=

function works.
 
Regards,
J=F6rg
-----Original Message-----
From: Daniel =
Reynes [mailto:daniel.reynes@...]
Sent: Friday, October 05, 2001=
 10:59 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE : [junit] Script with HttpU=
nit


Thank's Chris for your help.
This may help me to test JS.
But my real=
 problem was a little different :
I have a page where the login and passwor=
d parameters are set by a script
which is dependent on the browser type.
Th=
e problem is that Httpunit cannot recognize these parameters, and I cannot
=
set them in order to continue the test.
The script part of this page should=
 be interpreted first (if possible), and
then I could be able to set parame=
ters.
 
Is this possible with Junit or something else
Thank you
 
Dan 
 
 
=
-----Message d'origine-----
De :
sentto-2423328-2808-1002047782-daniel.reyn=
es=3Dtechlinksa.com@....
com
[mailto:sentto-2423328-2808-100204=
7782-daniel.reynes=3Dtechlinksa.com@returns.
onelist.com] De la part de Chr=
is Eppstein
Envoy=E9 : mardi 2 octobre 2001 20:27
=C0 : 'junit@yahoogroups.=
com'
Objet : RE: [junit] Script with HttpUnit
 
I work on a web app with ap=
prox 30klocs of javascript. I have found JsUnit
to be an excellent tool for=
 testing javascript. It is more important than
ever when working with a lan=
guage with no type checking and no compiler.
Here's a more direct link: htt=
p://www.edwardh.com/jsunit/
<http://www.edwardh.com/jsunit/> . I have augme=
nted this a system fair
amount with JSP's to customize it for our own needs=
 here at work by adding
autodiscovery of tests and test suites for selectio=
n in the test runner as
well as for dynamically generating test suites for =
each directory to
facilitate running all of the tests.
 
Hopefully you don'=
t have as much javascript to test. If you do then good
luck :-)
 
chris
---=
--Original Message-----
From: Dan Barthel [mailto:danbarthel@...=
t]
Sent: Tuesday, October 02, 2001 8:43 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subjec=
t: RE: [junit] Script with HttpUnit
There seems to be a JSUnit listed at ht=
tp://xprogramming.com/software.htm
<http://xprogramming.com/software.htm>  =
Maybe that will help.
 
Dan
-----Original Message-----
From: Daniel Reynes =
[mailto:daniel.reynes@...] 
Sent: Tuesday, October 02, 2001 10:4=
2 AM
To: Junit
Subject: [junit] Script with HttpUnit
I have to test some pa=
ges of a web site, and I tried to use HttpUnit.
Unfortunately, it seems tha=
t JavaScript is not supported.
Does anybody know if there is another way to=
 test these kind of pages, or if
there is another software that can do the =
job ?
 
Thanks in advance
 
Dan
